sen.j: 二条駅（にじょうえき）は、京都府京都市中京区西ノ京栂尾町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）・京都市交通局の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Nishinokyo Toganoo-cho, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, two Nijo stations exist, one of them being Nijo Station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) and the other Nijo Station of Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.

Two Nijo stations are located in Nishinokyo Toganoo-cho, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, one being Nijo Station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) and the other being Nijo Station of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.

Two Nijo stations are located in Nishinokyo Toganoo-cho, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, one being Nijo Station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) and the other being Nijo Station of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.

sen.j: JRの駅名電略は「オサニテ」。
sen.e: The telegraphic address for the name of the JR station is "Osanite."
The telegraphic address for the name of the JR station is "Osanite."
The telegraphic address for the name of the JR station is 'Osanite.'

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)

sen.j: 山陰本線（嵯峨野線） - 特急も含めた全ての列車が停車する。
sen.e: San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) - All trains including the limited express ones stop at this station
San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) - All trains, including those of the limited express type, stop at this station.
Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line): All trains, including those of the limited express type, stop at this station.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄
sen.e: Kyoto City Subway
Kyoto City Subway
Kyoto Municipal Subway

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄東西線（駅番号：T15）
sen.e: Tozai Line operated by Kyoto City Subway (the station number: T15)
The Tozai Line, operated by Kyoto City Subway (station number T15)
The Tozai Line, operated by Kyoto Municipal Subway (station number T15)

sen.j: JRの特定都区市内制度における「京都市内」の駅である。
sen.e: A station to which the clause of "within the Kyoto City area" in the specific city area system of JR is applied.
It's a station to which the clause "within the Kyoto City area" in the specific city area system of JR is applied.
It's a station to which the clause 'within the Kyoto City area' in the JR railway fare system of specific metropolitan and urban areas is applied.
sen.cmt: 特定特市内制度→railway fare system of specific metropolitan and urban areas としました。

sen.j: 両社局とも、ICOCA（西日本旅客鉄道）・PiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）の利用が可能（その他の相互利用可能ICカードについては当該項目を参照）。
sen.e: Both the bureau and company enable use of IOICA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (by SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION) (for other interchangeable cards, refer to the items concerned).
Both the bureau and company allow the use of IOICA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (by SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION) (for other interchangeable cards, refer to the items concerned).
Both the bureau and company allow the use of ICOCA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (by SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION) (for other interchangeable cards, refer to the items concerned).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: また、JスルーはJR駅のみ、スルッとKANSAI対応各種カードとトラフィカ京カードは京都市営地下鉄の駅のみ利用可能。
sen.e: Jr-through cards can be used only at JR stations, and cards supporting SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION and Traffica Kyoto cards are usable only at the subway stations.
J-Through cards can be used only at JR stations, while cards supporting SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION and Traffica Kyoto cards are usable only at the subway stations.
J-Through cards can be used only at JR stations, while cards supporting SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION and Traffica Kyoto cards are usable only at the subway stations.

sen.j: 現在は、プラットホーム形状と配置1面2線の高架駅で、駅舎の屋根は木造トラスである。
sen.e: At present, it is an over-track station with a platform serving two tracks and timber truss is used for the roof of the station house.
Currently, it's an over-track station with a platform serving two tracks, and timber trusses are used in the roof of the station house.
Currently, it's an elevated station with a platform serving two tracks, and timber trusses are used in the roof of the station house.

sen.j: 先代の駅舎との対比で、現在の駅舎のデザインに関しては賛否両論があるが、1997年度にグッドデザイン賞を受賞した。
sen.e: In comparison with the design of the previous station house, there exist many opinions for the present design, some being "for" and some "against," but the present one wan a good design award in the fiscal 1997.

In comparison with the design of the previous station house, there were many opinions for the present design, some being "for" and some "against," but the present one earned a "good design" award in fiscal year 1997.

In comparison with the design of the previous station house, there were many opinions for the present design, some being "for" and some "against," but the present one earned a "good design" award in fiscal year 1997.

sen.j: ホーム上からは、遠く比叡山などの山も見渡すことが出来る。
sen.e: From the platform, mountains, such as Mt. Hiei, can be seen.
From the platform, mountains such as Mt. Hiei can be seen.
From the platform, mountains such as Mt. Hiei can be seen.

sen.j: 高架駅化する前は、千本通り側からしか駅に入ることができなかった。
sen.e: Before it became an over-track station, no entrance was provided on the Sembon-dori Street side.
Before it became an over-track station, no entrance was provided on the Sembon-dori Street side.
Before it became an elevated station, no entrance was provided on the Senbon-dori Street side.
sen.cmt: 高架→elevated としました。Sembon → Senbon としました。

sen.j: 改札口からホームへは階段が2本、エレベーターが1本、上りエスカレータが1本通じている。
sen.e: Between the entrance/exit gate and the platform, two stairs, an elevator and an up-escalator are provided.
Between the entrance/exit gate and the platform, two stairs, an elevator and an up-escalator are provided.
Between the entrance/exit gate and the platform, two stairs, an elevator and an up-escalator are provided.

sen.j: また、改札口の前にはキヨスク・ハートインがある。
sen.e: Kiosk Heart-in is located in front of the entrance/exit gate.
Kiosk Heart-in is located in front of the entrance/exit gate.
Kiosk Heart-in is located in front of the entrance/exit gate.

sen.j: また、ホームには待合室・自動販売機があるが、売店などはない。
sen.e: On the platform, no shop is available although there is a waiting room and an automatic vending machine is installed.
No shopping is available on the platform, but a waiting room and an automatic vending machine are provided.
No shopping is available on the platform, but a waiting room and an automatic vending machine are provided.

sen.j: かつての地上駅時代、荘厳な社寺を彷彿とさせる造りで、貴賓室も設置された非常に立派な駅舎で全国的に知られていた。
sen.e: When being built on the ground level in the past, the station house was splendid and well known nationally, with the shape reminding a solemn shrine or temple, and a VIP room was provided there as well.

Though it was built on the ground level in the past, the station house was splendid and well known nationally, having a solemn shape reminiscent of a shrine or a temple, and a VIP room was provided as well.
In the era of the former station house which was built on the ground level, it was well known nationally, having a solemn shape reminiscent of a shrine or a temple, with a VIP room provided as well.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 京都鉄道の本社を兼ねた駅舎で、建築家の伊東忠太によって手掛けられたものである。
sen.e: The station house, designed by Chuta ITO, an architect, was used as the headquaters of Kyoto Electric Railway as well.
The station house, designed by the architect Chuta ITO, was also used as the headquarters of Kyoto Electric Railway.
The station house, designed by the architect Chuta ITO, was also used as the headquarters of Kyoto Electric Railway.

sen.j: 当初はレンガ造りの駅が計画されていたものの、二条城の近くでもあることから景観へ配慮して和風建築に改めたとも、東北本線宇都宮駅の駅舎が優美であったため模倣したとも言われている。
sen.e: It was initially planned that the station house was to be constructed with brick, but it is said that with the station being located near to Nijo-jo Castle, the plan was changed to a constuction of a Japanese style one considering the landscape or that since the station house of Utsunomiya Station on Tohoku Main Line was graceful, it followed the example.

It was initially planned that the station house would be constructed with brick, but it's said that with the station being located near to Nijo-jo Castle, the plan was changed to a construction in the Japanese style in consideration of the landscape, or that it would follow the graceful example set by the station house of Utsunomiya Station on the Tohoku Main Line.

It was initially planned that the station house would be constructed with brick, but it's said that with the station being located near to Nijo-jo Castle, the plan was changed to a construction in the Japanese style in consideration of the landscape, or that it would follow the graceful example set by the station house of Utsunomiya Station on the Tohoku Main Line.

sen.j: 1990年10月に二条 - 花園間の高架化工事に伴う仮線に支障するため、旧駅舎の建物を東側に15m移動させる曳屋工事が行われた。
sen.e: Becoming an obstacle to lay temporary tracks for the work of elevating the railway tracks between Nijo and Hanazono, the station house was moved, as it was, by 15 m to the east in October of 1990.
Becoming an obstacle to lay temporary tracks for the work of elevating the railway between Nijo and Hanazono, in October 1990 the station house was moved, as it was, 15 meters eastward.
Becoming an obstacle to lay temporary tracks for the work of elevating the railway between Nijo and Hanazono, in October 1990 the station house was moved, as it was, 15 meters eastward.

sen.j: この工事では約300トンの建物を2日間掛けて移動させた。
sen.e: It took two days to move the approx. 300-ton station house.
It took two days to move the station house, given its weight of approximately 300 tons.
It took two days to move the station house, given its weight of approximately 300 tons.

sen.j: その後高架化工事中の仮駅舎として使用が続けられたが、1996年に高架化工事と新駅舎の完成に伴って駅舎としての役割を終えた。
sen.e: After that, it was used as the temporary station house during the track elevation work, but it ended its role as a station house when the work to elevate the tracks and to build the new station house was completed in 1996.

Subsequently, it was used as the temporary station house during the track elevation work, but it ended its role as a station house in 1996 when the work of elevating the tracks and building the new station house was completed.

Subsequently, it was used as the temporary station house during the track elevation work, but it ended its role as a station house in 1996 when the work of elevating the tracks and building the new station house was completed.

sen.j: 明治期の和風駅舎建築として唯一の残存例であり、京都の近代化を象徴する建物でもあることから、1996年4月1日京都市指定文化財に指定され、幅を縮小して梅小路蒸気機関車館に移築されている。
sen.e: Being only one Japanese style station house remaining from the Meiji era and a building featuring the modernization of kyoto as well, the station house was designated as a Kyoto-designated cultural property on April 1, 1996 and was dismantled and reconstructed, with its widith reduced, in Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum.

Being the only Japanese-style station house remaining from the Meiji era as well as a building to symbolize the modernization of Kyoto, the station house became a Kyoto-designated cultural property on April 1, 1996 and was dismantled and reconstructed, albeit at reduced width, in the Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum.

Being the only Japanese-style station house remaining from the Meiji period as well as a building to symbolize the modernization of Kyoto, the station house became a Kyoto-designated cultural property on April 1, 1996 and was dismantled and reconstructed, albeit at reduced width, in the Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum.

sen.j: 島式ホーム1面2線の地下駅である。
sen.e: The station is placed underground, with an island platform serving two tracks.
The station is placed underground, and an island platform serves two tracks.
The station is placed underground, and an island platform serves two tracks.

sen.j: 東西線では駅ごとにステーションカラーが制定されており、二条駅のステーションカラーは山吹色である。
sen.e: A color is designated for each station on Tozai Line, and the color for Nijo Station is bright yellow.
Each station on the Tozai Line has a designated color, and the one for Nijo Station is bright yellow.
Each station on the Tozai Line has a designated color, and the one for Nijo Station is bright yellow.

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 二条城があるものの、観光客の利用は意外に少なく、むしろ近隣住民や学生利用の多さが目に付く。
sen.e: Although located near to Nijo-jo Castle, this station is not used by many turists, unexpectedly, and many of its users are found to be general public residing around it or students.
Although the station is located near to Nijo-jo Castle, surprisingly it isn't used by many tourists, and many of its users are found to be students or residents of the neighboring communities.
Although the station is located near to Nijo-jo Castle, surprisingly it isn't used by many tourists, and many of its users are found to be students or residents of the neighboring communities.

sen.j: 京都府北部(丹後)地方へ向かう特急の停車駅である。
sen.e: The limited express trains running in the direction of the nortern area of Kyoto Prefecture (Tango) stop at this station.
The limited express trains running in the direction of the nortern area of Kyoto Prefecture (Tango) stop at this station.
The limited express trains running in the direction of the northern area of Kyoto Prefecture (Tango) stop at this station.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 京都市中心部から京都府北部地方へ向かう場合は、この駅を利用する人も多い。
sen.e: Many of the persons who go from the cental area of Kyoto City to the nortern area of Kyoto Prefecture use this station.
Many of the people who go from the central area of Kyoto City to the northern area of Kyoto Prefecture use this station.
Many of the people who go from the central area of Kyoto City to the northern area of Kyoto Prefecture use this station.

sen.j: JR西日本
sen.e: JR West
JR West
JR West

sen.j: 2006年度の1日平均乗車人員は11,762人。
sen.e: The average number of persons getting on board at this station is 11,762 a day in the fiscal 2006..
The average number of persons who got on board at this station each day in fiscal 2006 was 11,762.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄

sen.j: 2006年度の1日平均乗車人員は9,696人。
sen.e: The average number of persons getting on board at this station is 9,696 a day in the fiscal 2006..

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 従来のJR駅は東の千本通側のみの出入り口であったが、地下鉄京都市営地下鉄東西線開通・山陰本線（嵯峨野線）の高架化以降は西側も整備され、近年は西口にも市バス・タクシーが乗り入れている。
sen.e: In the previous JR station, only one entranc/exit place was provided on the Sembon-dori Street side, but since Tozai Line run by Kyoto City Subway started its operation and the railway tracks of San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) were elevated, the area on its western side has been developed, with city buses and taxis becoming available on the west entrance side recently.

In the previous JR station, only one entrance/exit place was provided on the Sembon-dori Street side, but since the Tozai Line run by Kyoto City Subway started began operating and the railway tracks of the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) have been elevated, the area on its western side has been developed, and recently city buses and taxis have become available on the west entrance side.

In the previous JR station, only one entrance/exit place was provided on the east side, which is on the Senbon-dori Street side, but since the Tozai Line run by Kyoto Municipal Subway started began operating and the railway tracks of the Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line) have been elevated, the area on its western side has been developed, and recently city buses and taxis have become available on the west entrance side.

sen.j: 駅東側の千本通沿いには2000年9月に京都府歯科医師会口腔保健センター、2006年3月1日にJR二条駅NKビルがオープン。
sen.e: Along Sembon-dori Street on the east side of the station, Kyoto Dental Association Oral Health Center and JR Nijo Station NK Building opened in September, 2009 and on March 1, 2006, respectively.

Along Sembon-dori Street on the east side of the station, the Kyoto Dental Association Oral Health Center and the JR Nijo Station NK Building opened in September 2009 and on March 1, 2006, respectively.

Along Senbon-dori Street on the east side of the station, the Kyoto Dental Association Oral Health Center and the JR Nijo Station NK Building opened in September 2000 and on March 1, 2006, respectively.
sen.cmt: Sembon → Senbon としました。2000年 としました。

sen.j: 西側では2005年6月25日にTOHOシネマズなどが入る複合娯楽施設のBiVi二条が開業した。
sen.e: On the west side, BIVi Nijo, a complex ammusement facility where TOHO cinemas are placed, opened on June 25, 2005.
On the west side, BIVi Nijo, an amusement complex featuring TOHO cinemas, opened on June 25, 2005.
On the west side, BiVi Nijo, an amusement complex featuring TOHO cinemas, opened on June 25, 2005.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 駅の南東にあたる千本三条通交差点北西角には立命館大学朱雀キャンパス（中川会館）が2006年9月に開設、学校法人立命館本部や法科大学院などが移転した。
sen.e: In the area in the northwest corner of the Sembon-Sanjo-dori Street crossing, in the southeast of this station, Ritsumeikan Suzaku Campus (Nakagawa Kaikan) opened in September, 2006, and the headquaters of the Ritsumeikan incorporated institution and Ritsumeikan University School of Law moved into the area.

In the area in the northwest corner of the Sembon-Sanjo-dori Street crossing, southeast of this station, the Ritsumeikan Suzaku Campus (Nakagawa Kaikan) opened in September 2006, and the headquarters of the Ritsumeikan Incorporated Institution and Ritsumeikan University School of Law moved into the area.

In the area in the northwest corner of the Senbon-Sanjo-dori Street crossing, southeast of this station, the Ritsumeikan Suzaku Campus (Nakagawa Kaikan) opened in September 2006, and the headquarters of the Ritsumeikan Incorporated Institution and Ritsumeikan University School of Law moved into the area.

sen.j: さらにその北にオープン年度は不明だが、元来の土地保有者、日本郵政公社の関連かメルパルクホテルが建築される予定である。
sen.e: Although it is unknown exactly when it opens, it is scheduled that hotel Mielparque, realted to the original land owners and Japan Post ?, will be built in an area in the further north.
Although the precise opening date isn't known, it's scheduled that the hotel Mielparque, related to the original landowners and Japan Post?, will be built in an area further to the north.
Although the precise opening date isn't known, it's scheduled that the hotel Mielparque, related to Japan Post, the original landowner, will be built in an area further to the north.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 千本通が駅東側を南北に走る。
sen.e: Sembon-dori Street is located in the north-south direction on the east side of this station.
Sembon-dori Street is located in the north-south direction on the east side of the station.
Senbon-dori Street is located in the north-south direction on the east side of the station.

sen.j: また東西方向の御池通は当駅で分断されており、自動車はいったん駅北寄り高架下の押小路通を迂回し御池通に戻る形になっている。
sen.e: Oike-dori Street, running in the east-west direction, is severed at this station, and a vehicle must once enter Oshikoji-dori Street under the elevated tracks on the north side of the station and then must return to Oshikoji-dori Street.

Oike-dori Street, running in the east-west direction, is severed at this station, so a vehicle must enter Oshikoji-dori Street under the elevated tracks on the north side of the station and then return to Oshikoji-dori Street.

Oike-dori Street, running in the east-west direction, is severed at this station, so a vehicle must enter Oshikoji-dori Street under the elevated tracks on the north side of the station and then return to Oike-dori Street.

sen.j: 駅東側は千本通、御池通沿いを中心に多くの商店がある。
sen.e: On the east side of this station, many stores are located mainly along Sembon-dori Street and Oike-dori Street.
Many stores are found on the east side of the station, mainly along Sembon-dori Street and Oike-dori Street.
Many stores are found on the east side of the station, mainly along Senbon-dori Street and Oike-dori Street.

sen.j: 西側は西大路通に至るまで住宅地と中小の工場の密集地帯である。
sen.e: On the west side of this station, many houses and mid-/small-sized factories are densely located up to Nishioji-dori Street.
On the west side of this station, many houses and mid-/small-sized factories are densely packed up to Nishioji-dori Street.
On the west side of this station, many houses and mid-/small-sized factories are densely packed up to Nishioji-dori Street.

sen.j: 駅の北西に二条自動車教習所がある。
sen.e: Nijo Driving School is located in the northwest of this station.
The Nijo Driving School is located northwest of the station.
The Nijo Driving School is located northwest of the station.

sen.j: 隣の円町駅までは、山陰本線高架化に伴う道路整備により、側道を歩いて行くことができる。
sen.e: Since an improved road is provided along San'in Main Line corresponding to the elevation of the railway tracks, yo can walk to Emmachi Station, an adjacent station.
Because an improved road is provided along San'in Main Line corresponding to the elevation of the railway tracks, one can walk to the adjacent Emmachi Station.
Because an improved road is provided along Sanin Main Line corresponding to the elevation of the railway tracks, one can walk to the adjacent Emmachi Station.

sen.j: 駅周辺は京都市の副都心となりつつある。
sen.e: Its neighborhood has been becoming a secondary center of the city.
Its neighborhood has become a secondary center of the city.
Its neighborhood has become a secondary center of the city.

sen.j: 神泉苑、二条城、中京区総合庁舎（区役所）は駅の東300～500mにある。
sen.e: Shinsenen Temple, Nijo-jo Castle and the integrated Nakagyo Ward office (the Ward office) are located in a 300-m to 500-m east of this station.
Shinsenen Temple, Nijo-jo Castle and the integrated Nakagyo Ward office (the ward office) are located at distances of 300 meters to 500 meters east of the station.
Shinsen-en Temple, Nijo-jo Castle and the integrated Nakagyo Ward office (the ward office) are located at distances of 300 meters to 500 meters east of the station.

sen.j: 地下鉄利用の場合は隣の駅である二条城前駅からが近い。
sen.e: These places are nearer to Nijojo-mae Station when using the subway.
These places are nearer to Nijojo-mae Station for those who use the subway.

sen.j: 69系統：物集女方面 桂駅東口行
sen.e: Route 69: bound for Katsura Station-higashiguchi (the east entrance to Katsura Station) in the direction of Mozume
Route 69: Bound for Katsura Station-higashiguchi (the east entrance to Katsura Station) in the direction of Mozume
Route 69: Bound for Katsura Station-higashiguchi (the east entrance to Katsura Station) in the direction of Mozume

sen.e: Bound for Kansai International Airport and for Osaka International Airport
Bound for Kansai International Airport and Osaka International Airport
Bound for Kansai International Airport and Osaka International Airport

sen.j: また、駅東側にある千本通上に、二条駅前停留所がある。
sen.e: In addition, the Nijo Station-mae stop is located along Senbon-dori Street on its eastern side.
Additionally, the Nijo Station-mae stop is located along Senbon-dori Street on its eastern side.
Additionally, the Nijo-ekimae (front of Nijo Station) stop is located along Senbon-dori Street on its eastern side.
sen.cmt: Nijo-ekimae (front of Nijo Station)と補足しました。

sen.j: 二条駅前
sen.e: Nijo Station-mae (infront of Nijo Station)
Nijo Station-mae (in front of Nijo Station)
Nijo Station-mae (in front of Nijo Station)

sen.j: 京都市営バス
sen.e: Kyoto City bus
Kyoto City bus
Kyoto City bus

sen.j: 京都バス
sen.e: Kyoto Bus Co.,Ltd
Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd.
Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 西日本JRバス（高雄・京北線）
sen.e: West JR Bus Company (Takao Keihoku Route)
West JR Bus Company (Takao Keihoku Route)
West JR Bus Company (Takao Keihoku Route)

sen.j: 京都駅行/栂ノ尾・京北町行
sen.e: Bound for Kyoto Station/for Toganoo and Keihoku-cho
Bound for Kyoto Station and/or Toganoo and Keihoku-cho
Bound for Kyoto Station/Toganoo and Keihoku-cho
sen.cmt: and or を削除しました。

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）2月15日 - 京都鉄道 当駅～嵯峨嵐山駅間の開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: February 15, 1897 - Operation of this station started when Kyoto Electric Railway started its operation between this station and Saga-Arashiyama Station.
February 15, 1897 - This station came into use when Kyoto Electric Railway started operations between the station and Saga-Arashiyama Station.
February 15, 1897: This station came into use when Kyoto Electric Railway started operations between this station and Saga-Arashiyama Station.

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）4月27日 - 京都鉄道 大宮駅～当駅間が開通。
sen.e: April 27, 1897 - Kyoto Electric Railway started its operation between Omiya Station and this station.
April 27, 1897 - Kyoto Electric Railway started its operation between Omiya Station and this station.
April 27, 1897: Kyoto Electric Railway started its operation between Omiya Station and this station.

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）6月 - 京都鉄道本社屋を兼ねた駅舎完成。
sen.e: June 1904 - The construction of the station house, also playing the role of the headquarters of Kyoto Electric Railway, was completed.
June 1904 - The construction of the station house, which also served as the headquarters of Kyoto Electric Railway, was completed.
June 1904: The construction of the station house, which also served as the headquarters of Kyoto Electric Railway, was completed.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月1日 - 京都鉄道の国有化。
sen.e: August 1, 1907 - Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.
August 1, 1907 - Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.
August 1, 1907: Kyoto Electric Railway was nationalized.

sen.j: 1912年（明治45年）6月11日 - 京都市電千本線壬生車庫前-千本丸太町間開業に伴い、二条駅前停留所を設置。
sen.e: June 11, 1912 - When Kyoto City Trams started its operation between Mibu Shako-mae and Sembon Marutamachi on the Sembon Line, the Nijo Station-mae stop was introduced.
June 11, 1912 - The Nijo Station-mae stop was introduced when Kyoto City Trams started its operation between Mibu Shako-mae and Sembon Marutamachi on the Sembon Line.
June 11, 1912: The Nijo-ekimae stop was introduced when Kyoto City Trams started its operation between Mibu Shako-mae and Senbon Marutamachi on the Senbon Line.
sen.cmt: - → : としました。Nijo-ekimae stopとしました。

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）1月23日 - 京都市電千本線の廃止に伴い、二条駅前停留所廃止。
sen.e: January 23, 1972 - Use of the Nijo Station-mae stop was discontinued, when the operation of the Sembon Line run by Kyoto City Trams was discontinued.
January 23, 1972 - The use of the Nijo Station-mae stop ceased when the operation of the Sembon Line run by Kyoto City Trams was discontinued.
January 23, 1972: The use of the Nijo-ekimae stop ceased when the operation of the Senbon Line run by Kyoto City Trams was discontinued.
sen.cmt: - → : としました。Nijo-ekimae stopとしました。

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道・日本貨物鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - Due to the division and privatization of JNR, it becomes a station of West Japan Railway Company and of Japan Freight Railway Company.
April 1, 1987 - Due to the division and privatization of JNR, it became a station of the West Japan Railway Company and the Japan Freight Railway Company.
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of JNR, it became a station of the West Japan Railway Company and the Japan Freight Railway Company.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）10月 - 曳屋工事により駅舎を15m東側に移動させる。
sen.e: October, 1990 - The station house was moved, as it was, by 15 m to the east.
October, 1990 - The station house was moved eastward, as it was, by a distance of 15 meters.
October, 1990: The station house was moved eastward, as it was, by a distance of 15 meters.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）3月16日 - 高架駅化。
sen.e: March 16, 1996 - The work to elevate the railway tracks was completed.
March 16, 1996 - The work to elevate the railway tracks was completed.
March 16, 1996: The work to elevate the railway tracks was completed.

sen.j: 同時に貨物列車の設定廃止。
sen.e: At the same timing, the operation of setting up freight trains was discontinued.
sen.cmt: 意味が理解できませんでしたので、字句通りに訳してあります。
sen.e: Concurrently, the operation of setting up freight trains was discontinued.
Concurrently, the operation of setting up freight trains was discontinued.

sen.j: かつて 駅西側には小規模ながら貨物ヤードが存在し、ここから南方へ三条通を越えて日本食糧倉庫や油槽所へ専用鉄道が続いていた。
sen.e: In the past, a freight yard, although being small in the scale, existed on the west side of this station and a special railway from there to the Japan food warehouse and an oil storage place was provided in the south direction, over Sanjo-dori Street.

In the past, a freight yard, despite being small in scale, existed on the west side of this station and a special railway from there to the Japan Food Warehouse and an oil-storage site was provided in the south direction, over Sanjo-dori Street.

In the past, a freight yard, despite being small in scale, existed on the west side of this station and a special railway from there to the Japan Food Warehouse and an oil-storage site was provided in the south direction, over Sanjo-dori Street.

sen.j: 旧駅舎は梅小路蒸気機関車館に移設された。
sen.e: The former station house was dismantled and reconstructed, with its widith reduced, in Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum.
The former station house was dismantled and reconstructed, albeit at reduced width, in the Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum.
The former station house was dismantled and reconstructed, albeit at reduced width, in the Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）10月12日 - 京都市営地下鉄東西線の駅が開業。
sen.e: October 12, 1997 - Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway started its operation.
October 12, 1997 - The Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway went into operation.
October 12, 1997: The Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway went into operation.

sen.j: 当時は末端の駅だった。
sen.e: At that time, this station was a terminal.
At that time, this station was a terminal.
At that time, this station was a terminal.

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）4月1日 - JR貨物の貨物取扱が廃止。
sen.e: April 1, 2006 - The handling at this station of cargo for JR was discontinued.
April 1, 2006 - The handling of cargo for JR was discontinued at this station.
April 1, 2006: The handling of cargo for JR was discontinued at this station.

sen.j: 2008年（平成20年）1月16日 - 京都市営地下鉄東西線が当駅から太秦天神川駅まで延伸され、途中駅になる。
sen.e: January 16, 2008 - Operation of Tozai Line of Kyot City Subway was extended to Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station, removing the status as a terminal station from this station.
January 16, 2008 - The operation of the Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway was extended to Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station, thus depriving this station of its status as a terminal.
January 16, 2008: The operation of the Tozai Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway was extended to Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station, thus depriving this station of its status as a terminal.

sen.j: JR西日本の駅は2002年の第3回近畿の駅百選選定駅。
sen.e: Nijo Station of JR West is selceted in the third event for a selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
Nijo Station of JR West was chosen in the third event for the selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
Nijo Station of JR West was chosen in the third event for the selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region, which was held in 2002.

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。
